history.content:
According to the CS minor website:

"All minors must be declared no later than one semester before a student's Expected Graduation Term (EGT). If the semester before EGT is fall or spring, the deadline is the last day of RRR week. If the semester before EGT is summer, the deadline is the final Friday of Summer Sessions. To declare a minor, visit the department website for information on requirements and the declaration process."

and

"All minor requirements must be completed prior to the last day of finals during the semester in which you plan to graduate. If you cannot finish all courses required for the minor by that time, please see a College of Letters & Science adviser. "

Also keep in mind that double-majoring allows you to complete your requirements in 9 semesters, but minoring means you have to complete your requirements in 8 semesters (unless you are also under the unit ceiling, in which case you can take longer). Additionally, if you double-major then it's allowed for two upper divs to overlap between your majors, but if you're minoring, then only one upper div can overlap.

See more here--

http://guide.berkeley.edu/undergraduate/degree-programs/computer-science/#minorrequirementstext
If I double major in cs major but cannot finish it by the time I graduate, can I switch the cs major to a minor?
history.subject: Switch cs major to minor

history.content: If I declare cs major but cannot finish it by the time I graduate, can I switch the cs major to a minor?
history.subject: Switch cs major to minor
